page.title: 09 ST NICHOLAS CHURCH TOWER
page.content: On top of the church tower is a needle steeple covered in lead.It was once a sea-mark so Trinity House paid towards its repair.The tower has battlements & a turret staircase,it dates from about 1500.There are 111 steps in the tower. The first room we came to was where you ring the bells from.We were allowed to ring the bells and use the hand-bells. In the next room you can see the clock workings.In the next room are the bells there are 10 of them the bellringers practise every Friday.From the top of the tower you can see for miles.We saw the weather vane,it has a bullet hole in it from a German plane in the war. There is an acorn made of wood covered with copper which usually sits on the vane rod.It has just been repaired and is inside the church.We all touched it while we could before it is replaced.Mr Barlow,The Vicar,showed us around.
